Reviews.Title: Poor quality phone no recommend
Reviews.Author: Helmuth Ajun "helmuth"
Reviews.Content: Poor phone, no plain you help, I give a 20 % noteThe software no works properly , it's a nightmare

Reviews.Title: Terrible battery
Reviews.Author: O. B. Gaxiola
Reviews.Content: The phone in itself is as good as I've come to expect from Sony Ericsson. It's a nice, sleek & small phone, which is , along wiht the nice Camera why I chose it. The battery life, though is awful. It doesn't last a  work day without being depleted - and I don't really use it that much. I tought it may be the battery so I changed it (for an original, even) and still got the same.I don't know, I'm just wild guessing that maybe the screen gets accidentally lit on while in the purse or something, but if that is the case, then I think the design should've prevented the phone from potentially depleting the battery while not in use - I mean, the blocking could maybe have been a sliding bar instead of a touch button.UPDATE: I've had this phone now for almost a year, and I completely regret buying it. It freezes and shuts down constantly.  I don't have enough money to buy a new cell, but when I do, It won't be a Sony Ericsson anymore, I'm very dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: Short battery life time.
Reviews.Author: Zaiboot
Reviews.Content: Short battery life time.I use it for 3G internet, SMS, audio player, radio. I guess it is normal. 4 stars of five because of the battery.

ProductInfo.Features:
Quad-band GSM/GPRS/EDGE: 850/900/1800/1900 MHz. HSDPA 900 / 2100
Operating System: Symbian Series 60, 5th edition. Processor: 720 MHz. GPS with A-GPS support, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g, DLNA. Bluetooth v2.1 with A2DP.
Display: 3.2 inches, 360 x 640 pixels, Accelerometer sensor for UI auto-rotate, Scratch-resistant surface,
Camera: 8 MP, 3264x2448 pixels, autofocus, LED flash, Video calling, touch focus, geo-tagging, face and smile detection.
Talk time: Up to 13 h (2G) / Up to 5 h 20 min (3G). Standby time: Up to 430 h (2G) / Up to 440 h (3G)
Stereo FM radio. Video player, Music player, TrackID music recognition
Turn-to-mute and snoozing alarms, Handwriting recognition. Organizer, QuickOffice document reader. Card Slot: microSD, up to 32 GB, 8GB included
Video: 720p@24fps, continuous autofocus, video light.
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Ericsson Vivaz U5i Unlocked GSM Smartphone with 8 MP Camera, Symbian OS, Touch Screen, Wi-Fi and GPS--International Version with No Warranty (Silver)
